snippet: After every rain delay at the U.S. Open, 75 or so workers use an array of machines to push hundreds of gallons of water off the courts, then get on their hands and knees and use towels to mop up what's left.
abstract: After every rain delay at the U.S. Open, 75 or so workers use an array of machines to push hundreds of gallons of water off the courts, then get on their hands and knees and use towels to mop up what's left.

headline.main: For U.S. Open Grounds Crew, an Arsenal to Combat Wet Courts
